page.title: 18THE INCINERATOR
page.content: Within our area lies the local authority incineration station. This was built to provide a cheap and efficient method of getting rid of the refuse from the area, and recycling any metal products. Each week about 2,000 tons of rubbish are taken to the incinerator.After processsing lorries take the resulting ash to a nearby tip. This tip will soon be full and it will be landscaped to improve the environment.However this wil leave the authority with the problem of what to do with the result of the incinerating process. The fumes which are produced from burning the rubbish are passed through a precipitator which cleans them. The cleaned fumes are then sucked out by fans, and dispersed by a chimney.
